      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In the TruboFan compiler of v8, a range miscalculation bug in the typer can be triggered due to an off-by-one involving type bounds of "kAdditiveSafeInteger".<span class="line"><!---->In the TruboFan compiler of v8, a range miscalculation bug in the typer can be triggered due to an off-by-one involving type bounds of "kAdditiveSafeInteger".<!----></span><br>This can be used to crash v8 (via triggering a Throw-node) - and thus the browser tab of Chrome - , however due to the specifics of the bug I am not certain whether it can be leveraged into an out-of-bounds access or a fake object construction.<span class="line"><!---->This can be used to crash v8 (via triggering a Throw-node) - and thus the browser tab of Chrome - , however due to the specifics of the bug I am not certain whether it can be leveraged into an out-of-bounds access or a fake object construction.<!----></span><br><br>In v8's TurboFan compiler, during the type-hint lowering step, an addition with type hint "kSignedSmall" or "kSigned32" will be compiled to a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd" node (see SpeculativeNumberOp() in v8/src/compiler/js-type-hint-lowering.cc). (Everything stated here simliarly applies to subtraction, which will generate a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerSubtract" node.)<span class="line"><!---->In v8's TurboFan compiler, during the type-hint lowering step, an addition with type hint "kSignedSmall" or "kSigned32" will be compiled to a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd" node (see SpeculativeNumberOp() in v8/src/compiler/js-type-hint-lowering.cc). (Everything stated here simliarly applies to subtraction, which will generate a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerSubtract" node.)<!----></span><br><br>During the typer stage, the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node is typed to `kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` (in v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc):<span class="line"><!---->During the typer stage, the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node is typed to `kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` (in v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc):<!----></span><br>  Type OperationTyper::SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd(Type lhs, Type rhs) {<span class="line"><!---->  Type OperationTyper::SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd(Type lhs, Type rhs) {<!----></span><br>    Type result = SpeculativeNumberAdd(lhs, rhs);<span class="line"><!---->    Type result = SpeculativeNumberAdd(lhs, rhs);<!----></span><br>    // If we have a Smi or Int32 feedback, the representation selection will<span class="line"><!---->    // If we have a Smi or Int32 feedback, the representation selection will<!----></span><br>    // either truncate or it will check the inputs (i.e., deopt if not int32).<span class="line"><!---->    // either truncate or it will check the inputs (i.e., deopt if not int32).<!----></span><br>    // In either case the result will be in the safe integer range, so we<span class="line"><!---->    // In either case the result will be in the safe integer range, so we<!----></span><br>    // can bake in the type here. This needs to be in sync with<span class="line"><!---->    // can bake in the type here. This needs to be in sync with<!----></span><br>    // SimplifiedLowering::VisitSpeculativeAdditiveOp.<span class="line"><!---->    // SimplifiedLowering::VisitSpeculativeAdditiveOp.<!----></span><br>    return Type::Intersect(result, cache_->kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, zone());<span class="line"><!---->    return Type::Intersect(result, cache_-&gt;kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, zone());<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>During the simplified lowering stage, the node will be handled by `VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp` (in v8/src/compiler/simplified-lowering.cc):<span class="line"><!---->During the simplified lowering stage, the node will be handled by `VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp` (in v8/src/compiler/simplified-lowering.cc):<!----></span><br><br>  void VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp(Node* node, Truncation truncation,<span class="line"><!---->  void VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp(Node* node, Truncation truncation,<!----></span><br>                                         SimplifiedLowering* lowering) {<span class="line"><!---->                                         SimplifiedLowering* lowering) {<!----></span><br>    Type left_upper = GetUpperBound(node->InputAt(0));<span class="line"><!---->    Type left_upper = GetUpperBound(node-&gt;InputAt(0));<!----></span><br>    Type right_upper = GetUpperBound(node->InputAt(1));<span class="line"><!---->    Type right_upper = GetUpperBound(node-&gt;InputAt(1));<!----></span><br><br>    if (left_upper.Is(type_cache_->kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero) &&<span class="line"><!---->    if (left_upper.Is(type_cache_-&gt;kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        right_upper.Is(type_cache_->kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero)) {<span class="line"><!---->        right_upper.Is(type_cache_-&gt;kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero)) {<!----></span><br>      // Only eliminate the node if its typing rule can be satisfied, namely<span class="line"><!---->      // Only eliminate the node if its typing rule can be satisfied, namely<!----></span><br>      // that a safe integer is produced.<span class="line"><!---->      // that a safe integer is produced.<!----></span><br>      if (truncation.IsUnused()) return VisitUnused<T>(node);<span class="line"><!---->      if (truncation.IsUnused()) return VisitUnused&lt;T&gt;(node);<!----></span><br><br>      // If we know how to interpret the result or if the users only care<span class="line"><!---->      // If we know how to interpret the result or if the users only care<!----></span><br>      // about the low 32-bits, we can truncate to Word32 do a wrapping<span class="line"><!---->      // about the low 32-bits, we can truncate to Word32 do a wrapping<!----></span><br>      // addition.<span class="line"><!---->      // addition.<!----></span><br>      if (GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Signed32()) ||<span class="line"><!---->      if (GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Signed32()) ||<!----></span><br>          GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Unsigned32()) ||<span class="line"><!---->          GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Unsigned32()) ||<!----></span><br>          truncation.IsUsedAsWord32()) {<span class="line"><!---->          truncation.IsUsedAsWord32()) {<!----></span><br>        // => Int32Add/Sub<span class="line"><!---->        // =&gt; Int32Add/Sub<!----></span><br>        VisitWord32TruncatingBinop<T>(node);<span class="line"><!---->        VisitWord32TruncatingBinop&lt;T&gt;(node);<!----></span><br>        if (lower<T>()) ChangeToPureOp(node, Int32Op(node));<span class="line"><!---->        if (lower&lt;T&gt;()) ChangeToPureOp(node, Int32Op(node));<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>In particular, the node is changed to a pure (unchecked) Int32-addition, if both of the following conditions are met:<span class="line"><!---->In particular, the node is changed to a pure (unchecked) Int32-addition, if both of the following conditions are met:<!----></span><br>- Both inputs are guaranteed to be in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type<span class="line"><!---->- Both inputs are guaranteed to be in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type<!----></span><br>- Either the output is guaranteed to be in the (Un)Signed32 type, or the output's truncation type is set to Word32 (when the output is only ever used after truncating it to an Int32)<span class="line"><!---->- Either the output is guaranteed to be in the (Un)Signed32 type, or the output's truncation type is set to Word32 (when the output is only ever used after truncating it to an Int32)<!----></span><br><br>However, the type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero is defined as follows (in v8/src/compiler/type-cache.h):<span class="line"><!---->However, the type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero is defined as follows (in v8/src/compiler/type-cache.h):<!----></span><br>  Type const kAdditiveSafeInteger =<span class="line"><!---->  Type const kAdditiveSafeInteger =<!----></span><br>      CreateRange(-4503599627370496.0, 4503599627370496.0);<span class="line"><!---->      CreateRange(-4503599627370496.0, 4503599627370496.0);<!----></span><br>  Type const kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero =<span class="line"><!---->  Type const kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero =<!----></span><br>      Type::Union(kAdditiveSafeInteger, Type::MinusZero(), zone());<span class="line"><!---->      Type::Union(kAdditiveSafeInteger, Type::MinusZero(), zone());<!----></span><br>While kSafeInteger is defined as `CreateRange(-kMaxSafeInteger, kMaxSafeInteger)` where `kMaxSafeInteger` equals 9007199254740991.<span class="line"><!---->While kSafeInteger is defined as `CreateRange(-kMaxSafeInteger, kMaxSafeInteger)` where `kMaxSafeInteger` equals 9007199254740991.<!----></span><br>Note that 4503599627370496+4503599627370496 equals 9007199254740992, which exceeds the kSafeInteger type; so if both inputs equal 4503599627370496 (or both -4503599627370496), the output's type constraint is violated.<span class="line"><!---->Note that 4503599627370496+4503599627370496 equals 9007199254740992, which exceeds the kSafeInteger type; so if both inputs equal 4503599627370496 (or both -4503599627370496), the output's type constraint is violated.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the bug, the following conditions need to be met:<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the bug, the following conditions need to be met:<!----></span><br> 1. We need an integer addition with type hint kSignedSmall or kSigned32<span class="line"><!----> 1. We need an integer addition with type hint kSignedSmall or kSigned32<!----></span><br> 2. The input types need to be constrained to kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero<span class="line"><!----> 2. The input types need to be constrained to kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero<!----></span><br> 3. The output needs to be truncated to a 32-bit word<span class="line"><!----> 3. The output needs to be truncated to a 32-bit word<!----></span><br>The first condition guarantees that a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` is generated, while conditions 2 and 3 guarantee the conversion to an unconditional Int32Add (we can not allow the operation to be converted to a checked Int32 addition, as this would result in a deoptimization as soon as the inputs actually are 4503599627370496).<span class="line"><!---->The first condition guarantees that a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` is generated, while conditions 2 and 3 guarantee the conversion to an unconditional Int32Add (we can not allow the operation to be converted to a checked Int32 addition, as this would result in a deoptimization as soon as the inputs actually are 4503599627370496).<!----></span><br>This results in a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node that is typed to output a maximum of 9007199254740991, but that still accepts both inputs to be 4503599627370496.<span class="line"><!---->This results in a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node that is typed to output a maximum of 9007199254740991, but that still accepts both inputs to be 4503599627370496.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the bug in a potentially more useful way, we want to have a (true) lower bound on the output as well that is not much lower than 9007199254740991.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the bug in a potentially more useful way, we want to have a (true) lower bound on the output as well that is not much lower than 9007199254740991.<!----></span><br>This at first seems contradictory to condition 1, as we need an addition that is assigned a small type hint, but which is actually guaranteed a lower bound much higher than 2^32 = 4294967296.<span class="line"><!---->This at first seems contradictory to condition 1, as we need an addition that is assigned a small type hint, but which is actually guaranteed a lower bound much higher than 2^32 = 4294967296.<!----></span><br>However, this goal can be accomplished using inlining: We can first "train" one method, which contains an addition (as well as the necessary code to guarantee its inputs to have type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, and a bitwise operation which forces the addition's truncation type to Word32) using small operands; and then, after it has been compiled by TurboFan, call this method from a second method with parameters now constrained to be nearly 4503599627370496.<span class="line"><!---->However, this goal can be accomplished using inlining: We can first "train" one method, which contains an addition (as well as the necessary code to guarantee its inputs to have type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, and a bitwise operation which forces the addition's truncation type to Word32) using small operands; and then, after it has been compiled by TurboFan, call this method from a second method with parameters now constrained to be nearly 4503599627370496.<!----></span><br>This will let the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node (that has already been generated) be inlined into the second function, where the new bounds are propagated during the typer stage.<span class="line"><!---->This will let the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node (that has already been generated) be inlined into the second function, where the new bounds are propagated during the typer stage.<!----></span><br><br>In particular, if the second method constrains its operands to just `Range(4503599627370496, 4503599627370496)`, this will result in a crash: The typer phase will simultaneously reason the result to be at least 2*4503599627370496=9007199254740992, but also at most 9007199254740991, resulting in the type to be reduced to the `None` type.<span class="line"><!---->In particular, if the second method constrains its operands to just `Range(4503599627370496, 4503599627370496)`, this will result in a crash: The typer phase will simultaneously reason the result to be at least 2*4503599627370496=9007199254740992, but also at most 9007199254740991, resulting in the type to be reduced to the `None` type.<!----></span><br>During Dead Code Elimination, this node will be marked as Unreachable, resulting in a `Throw` node.<span class="line"><!---->During Dead Code Elimination, this node will be marked as Unreachable, resulting in a `Throw` node.<!----></span><br><br><br>Even though this range miscalculation is a violation of potentially security-relevant assumptions, I did not manage to exploit it further.<span class="line"><!---->Even though this range miscalculation is a violation of potentially security-relevant assumptions, I did not manage to exploit it further.<!----></span><br>While the primitive can be used to construct a node of type `Range(a, 9007199254740991)` with an arbitrary `a` that in reality contains the value `9007199254740992`, recall that one of the conditions it that the node's truncation type is Word32.<span class="line"><!---->While the primitive can be used to construct a node of type `Range(a, 9007199254740991)` with an arbitrary `a` that in reality contains the value `9007199254740992`, recall that one of the conditions it that the node's truncation type is Word32.<!----></span><br>However, all operations (that I could find) that intrinsically truncate to Word32 use typing logic similar to the following from `v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc`:<span class="line"><!---->However, all operations (that I could find) that intrinsically truncate to Word32 use typing logic similar to the following from `v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc`:<!----></span><br><br>  Type OperationTyper::NumberToInt32(Type type) {<span class="line"><!---->  Type OperationTyper::NumberToInt32(Type type) {<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(type.Is(Type::Number()));<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(type.Is(Type::Number()));<!----></span><br><br>    if (type.Is(Type::Signed32())) return type;<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(Type::Signed32())) return type;<!----></span><br>    if (type.Is(cache_->kZeroish)) return cache_->kSingletonZero;<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(cache_-&gt;kZeroish)) return cache_-&gt;kSingletonZero;<!----></span><br>    if (type.Is(signed32ish_)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(signed32ish_)) {<!----></span><br>      return Type::Intersect(Type::Union(type, cache_->kSingletonZero, zone()),<span class="line"><!---->      return Type::Intersect(Type::Union(type, cache_-&gt;kSingletonZero, zone()),<!----></span><br>                           Type::Signed32(), zone());<span class="line"><!---->                           Type::Signed32(), zone());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return Type::Signed32();<span class="line"><!---->    return Type::Signed32();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>While those operations could use information from a range with both bounds being 32-bit values, they cannot infer from an input range of the form `Range(a*2^32+b,a*2^32+c)` with `0<=b<c<2^32` and `a>0` that the output will be in `Range(b,c)` - instead they simply set the output to an unconstrained `Signed32` (or `Unsigned32`) type.<span class="line"><!---->While those operations could use information from a range with both bounds being 32-bit values, they cannot infer from an input range of the form `Range(a*2^32+b,a*2^32+c)` with `0&lt;=b&lt;c&lt;2^32` and `a&gt;0` that the output will be in `Range(b,c)` - instead they simply set the output to an unconstrained `Signed32` (or `Unsigned32`) type.<!----></span><br><br>Also, we cannot subtract any fixed value to "shift" the range inside the 32-bit range; recall that one of the conditions for the generation of an (unchecked) Int32 addition is that both inputs are in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type - this clearly can not be the case for our range, which always contains `9007199254740991` (if it isn't empty); thus any following addition or subtraction won't propagate the Word32-truncation to the output of our original addition.<span class="line"><!---->Also, we cannot subtract any fixed value to "shift" the range inside the 32-bit range; recall that one of the conditions for the generation of an (unchecked) Int32 addition is that both inputs are in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type - this clearly can not be the case for our range, which always contains `9007199254740991` (if it isn't empty); thus any following addition or subtraction won't propagate the Word32-truncation to the output of our original addition.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>The crash has been tested on a debug build of the current master branch of v8 (as of 2020-04-13), as well as in browser version Chromium 89.0.4389.114 on Arch Linux.<span class="line"><!---->The crash has been tested on a debug build of the current master branch of v8 (as of 2020-04-13), as well as in browser version Chromium 89.0.4389.114 on Arch Linux.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>A proof of concept that crashes v8 is attached as `bug.js` (run as `d8 bug.js --allow-natives-syntax`), a version that crashes the chromium tab is attached as `bug.html`.<span class="line"><!---->A proof of concept that crashes v8 is attached as `bug.js` (run as `d8 bug.js --allow-natives-syntax`), a version that crashes the chromium tab is attached as `bug.html`.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Manfred Paul<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Manfred Paul<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          bug.js<b><!---->bug.js<!----></b>

        </div>

        I agree with the analysis that it seems impossible to exploit this, but I wouldn't bet my life on it. I'm keeping it as a Bug-Security and setting Medium severity ("not harmful on their own but potentially harmful when combined with other bugs"). +adetaylor, please let me know if this classification seems off.<span class="line"><!---->I agree with the analysis that it seems impossible to exploit this, but I wouldn't bet my life on it.         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1198705: Security: Range miscalculation for nodes of type SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd in v8's TurboFan
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1198705: Security: Range miscalculation for nodes of type SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd in v8's TurboFan
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      manfp...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3677492351" title="manfp...@gmail.com"><!---->manfp...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      manfp...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->manfp...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        Description #1 by manfp...@gmail.com (Apr 13, 2021)

      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>In the TruboFan compiler of v8, a range miscalculation bug in the typer can be triggered due to an off-by-one involving type bounds of "kAdditiveSafeInteger".<span class="line"><!---->In the TruboFan compiler of v8, a range miscalculation bug in the typer can be triggered due to an off-by-one involving type bounds of "kAdditiveSafeInteger".<!----></span><br>This can be used to crash v8 (via triggering a Throw-node) - and thus the browser tab of Chrome - , however due to the specifics of the bug I am not certain whether it can be leveraged into an out-of-bounds access or a fake object construction.<span class="line"><!---->This can be used to crash v8 (via triggering a Throw-node) - and thus the browser tab of Chrome - , however due to the specifics of the bug I am not certain whether it can be leveraged into an out-of-bounds access or a fake object construction.<!----></span><br><br>In v8's TurboFan compiler, during the type-hint lowering step, an addition with type hint "kSignedSmall" or "kSigned32" will be compiled to a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd" node (see SpeculativeNumberOp() in v8/src/compiler/js-type-hint-lowering.cc). (Everything stated here simliarly applies to subtraction, which will generate a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerSubtract" node.)<span class="line"><!---->In v8's TurboFan compiler, during the type-hint lowering step, an addition with type hint "kSignedSmall" or "kSigned32" will be compiled to a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd" node (see SpeculativeNumberOp() in v8/src/compiler/js-type-hint-lowering.cc). (Everything stated here simliarly applies to subtraction, which will generate a "SpeculativeSafeIntegerSubtract" node.)<!----></span><br><br>During the typer stage, the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node is typed to `kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` (in v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc):<span class="line"><!---->During the typer stage, the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node is typed to `kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` (in v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc):<!----></span><br>  Type OperationTyper::SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd(Type lhs, Type rhs) {<span class="line"><!---->  Type OperationTyper::SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd(Type lhs, Type rhs) {<!----></span><br>    Type result = SpeculativeNumberAdd(lhs, rhs);<span class="line"><!---->    Type result = SpeculativeNumberAdd(lhs, rhs);<!----></span><br>    // If we have a Smi or Int32 feedback, the representation selection will<span class="line"><!---->    // If we have a Smi or Int32 feedback, the representation selection will<!----></span><br>    // either truncate or it will check the inputs (i.e., deopt if not int32).<span class="line"><!---->    // either truncate or it will check the inputs (i.e., deopt if not int32).<!----></span><br>    // In either case the result will be in the safe integer range, so we<span class="line"><!---->    // In either case the result will be in the safe integer range, so we<!----></span><br>    // can bake in the type here. This needs to be in sync with<span class="line"><!---->    // can bake in the type here. This needs to be in sync with<!----></span><br>    // SimplifiedLowering::VisitSpeculativeAdditiveOp.<span class="line"><!---->    // SimplifiedLowering::VisitSpeculativeAdditiveOp.<!----></span><br>    return Type::Intersect(result, cache_->kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, zone());<span class="line"><!---->    return Type::Intersect(result, cache_-&gt;kSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, zone());<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>During the simplified lowering stage, the node will be handled by `VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp` (in v8/src/compiler/simplified-lowering.cc):<span class="line"><!---->During the simplified lowering stage, the node will be handled by `VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp` (in v8/src/compiler/simplified-lowering.cc):<!----></span><br><br>  void VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp(Node* node, Truncation truncation,<span class="line"><!---->  void VisitSpeculativeIntegerAdditiveOp(Node* node, Truncation truncation,<!----></span><br>                                         SimplifiedLowering* lowering) {<span class="line"><!---->                                         SimplifiedLowering* lowering) {<!----></span><br>    Type left_upper = GetUpperBound(node->InputAt(0));<span class="line"><!---->    Type left_upper = GetUpperBound(node-&gt;InputAt(0));<!----></span><br>    Type right_upper = GetUpperBound(node->InputAt(1));<span class="line"><!---->    Type right_upper = GetUpperBound(node-&gt;InputAt(1));<!----></span><br><br>    if (left_upper.Is(type_cache_->kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero) &&<span class="line"><!---->    if (left_upper.Is(type_cache_-&gt;kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>        right_upper.Is(type_cache_->kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero)) {<span class="line"><!---->        right_upper.Is(type_cache_-&gt;kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero)) {<!----></span><br>      // Only eliminate the node if its typing rule can be satisfied, namely<span class="line"><!---->      // Only eliminate the node if its typing rule can be satisfied, namely<!----></span><br>      // that a safe integer is produced.<span class="line"><!---->      // that a safe integer is produced.<!----></span><br>      if (truncation.IsUnused()) return VisitUnused<T>(node);<span class="line"><!---->      if (truncation.IsUnused()) return VisitUnused&lt;T&gt;(node);<!----></span><br><br>      // If we know how to interpret the result or if the users only care<span class="line"><!---->      // If we know how to interpret the result or if the users only care<!----></span><br>      // about the low 32-bits, we can truncate to Word32 do a wrapping<span class="line"><!---->      // about the low 32-bits, we can truncate to Word32 do a wrapping<!----></span><br>      // addition.<span class="line"><!---->      // addition.<!----></span><br>      if (GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Signed32()) ||<span class="line"><!---->      if (GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Signed32()) ||<!----></span><br>          GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Unsigned32()) ||<span class="line"><!---->          GetUpperBound(node).Is(Type::Unsigned32()) ||<!----></span><br>          truncation.IsUsedAsWord32()) {<span class="line"><!---->          truncation.IsUsedAsWord32()) {<!----></span><br>        // => Int32Add/Sub<span class="line"><!---->        // =&gt; Int32Add/Sub<!----></span><br>        VisitWord32TruncatingBinop<T>(node);<span class="line"><!---->        VisitWord32TruncatingBinop&lt;T&gt;(node);<!----></span><br>        if (lower<T>()) ChangeToPureOp(node, Int32Op(node));<span class="line"><!---->        if (lower&lt;T&gt;()) ChangeToPureOp(node, Int32Op(node));<!----></span><br>        return;<span class="line"><!---->        return;<!----></span><br>      }<span class="line"><!---->      }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    ...<span class="line"><!---->    ...<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>In particular, the node is changed to a pure (unchecked) Int32-addition, if both of the following conditions are met:<span class="line"><!---->In particular, the node is changed to a pure (unchecked) Int32-addition, if both of the following conditions are met:<!----></span><br>- Both inputs are guaranteed to be in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type<span class="line"><!---->- Both inputs are guaranteed to be in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type<!----></span><br>- Either the output is guaranteed to be in the (Un)Signed32 type, or the output's truncation type is set to Word32 (when the output is only ever used after truncating it to an Int32)<span class="line"><!---->- Either the output is guaranteed to be in the (Un)Signed32 type, or the output's truncation type is set to Word32 (when the output is only ever used after truncating it to an Int32)<!----></span><br><br>However, the type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero is defined as follows (in v8/src/compiler/type-cache.h):<span class="line"><!---->However, the type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero is defined as follows (in v8/src/compiler/type-cache.h):<!----></span><br>  Type const kAdditiveSafeInteger =<span class="line"><!---->  Type const kAdditiveSafeInteger =<!----></span><br>      CreateRange(-4503599627370496.0, 4503599627370496.0);<span class="line"><!---->      CreateRange(-4503599627370496.0, 4503599627370496.0);<!----></span><br>  Type const kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero =<span class="line"><!---->  Type const kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero =<!----></span><br>      Type::Union(kAdditiveSafeInteger, Type::MinusZero(), zone());<span class="line"><!---->      Type::Union(kAdditiveSafeInteger, Type::MinusZero(), zone());<!----></span><br>While kSafeInteger is defined as `CreateRange(-kMaxSafeInteger, kMaxSafeInteger)` where `kMaxSafeInteger` equals 9007199254740991.<span class="line"><!---->While kSafeInteger is defined as `CreateRange(-kMaxSafeInteger, kMaxSafeInteger)` where `kMaxSafeInteger` equals 9007199254740991.<!----></span><br>Note that 4503599627370496+4503599627370496 equals 9007199254740992, which exceeds the kSafeInteger type; so if both inputs equal 4503599627370496 (or both -4503599627370496), the output's type constraint is violated.<span class="line"><!---->Note that 4503599627370496+4503599627370496 equals 9007199254740992, which exceeds the kSafeInteger type; so if both inputs equal 4503599627370496 (or both -4503599627370496), the output's type constraint is violated.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the bug, the following conditions need to be met:<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the bug, the following conditions need to be met:<!----></span><br> 1. We need an integer addition with type hint kSignedSmall or kSigned32<span class="line"><!----> 1. We need an integer addition with type hint kSignedSmall or kSigned32<!----></span><br> 2. The input types need to be constrained to kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero<span class="line"><!----> 2. The input types need to be constrained to kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero<!----></span><br> 3. The output needs to be truncated to a 32-bit word<span class="line"><!----> 3. The output needs to be truncated to a 32-bit word<!----></span><br>The first condition guarantees that a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` is generated, while conditions 2 and 3 guarantee the conversion to an unconditional Int32Add (we can not allow the operation to be converted to a checked Int32 addition, as this would result in a deoptimization as soon as the inputs actually are 4503599627370496).<span class="line"><!---->The first condition guarantees that a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` is generated, while conditions 2 and 3 guarantee the conversion to an unconditional Int32Add (we can not allow the operation to be converted to a checked Int32 addition, as this would result in a deoptimization as soon as the inputs actually are 4503599627370496).<!----></span><br>This results in a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node that is typed to output a maximum of 9007199254740991, but that still accepts both inputs to be 4503599627370496.<span class="line"><!---->This results in a `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node that is typed to output a maximum of 9007199254740991, but that still accepts both inputs to be 4503599627370496.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the bug in a potentially more useful way, we want to have a (true) lower bound on the output as well that is not much lower than 9007199254740991.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the bug in a potentially more useful way, we want to have a (true) lower bound on the output as well that is not much lower than 9007199254740991.<!----></span><br>This at first seems contradictory to condition 1, as we need an addition that is assigned a small type hint, but which is actually guaranteed a lower bound much higher than 2^32 = 4294967296.<span class="line"><!---->This at first seems contradictory to condition 1, as we need an addition that is assigned a small type hint, but which is actually guaranteed a lower bound much higher than 2^32 = 4294967296.<!----></span><br>However, this goal can be accomplished using inlining: We can first "train" one method, which contains an addition (as well as the necessary code to guarantee its inputs to have type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, and a bitwise operation which forces the addition's truncation type to Word32) using small operands; and then, after it has been compiled by TurboFan, call this method from a second method with parameters now constrained to be nearly 4503599627370496.<span class="line"><!---->However, this goal can be accomplished using inlining: We can first "train" one method, which contains an addition (as well as the necessary code to guarantee its inputs to have type kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero, and a bitwise operation which forces the addition's truncation type to Word32) using small operands; and then, after it has been compiled by TurboFan, call this method from a second method with parameters now constrained to be nearly 4503599627370496.<!----></span><br>This will let the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node (that has already been generated) be inlined into the second function, where the new bounds are propagated during the typer stage.<span class="line"><!---->This will let the `SpeculativeSafeIntegerAdd` node (that has already been generated) be inlined into the second function, where the new bounds are propagated during the typer stage.<!----></span><br><br>In particular, if the second method constrains its operands to just `Range(4503599627370496, 4503599627370496)`, this will result in a crash: The typer phase will simultaneously reason the result to be at least 2*4503599627370496=9007199254740992, but also at most 9007199254740991, resulting in the type to be reduced to the `None` type.<span class="line"><!---->In particular, if the second method constrains its operands to just `Range(4503599627370496, 4503599627370496)`, this will result in a crash: The typer phase will simultaneously reason the result to be at least 2*4503599627370496=9007199254740992, but also at most 9007199254740991, resulting in the type to be reduced to the `None` type.<!----></span><br>During Dead Code Elimination, this node will be marked as Unreachable, resulting in a `Throw` node.<span class="line"><!---->During Dead Code Elimination, this node will be marked as Unreachable, resulting in a `Throw` node.<!----></span><br><br><br>Even though this range miscalculation is a violation of potentially security-relevant assumptions, I did not manage to exploit it further.<span class="line"><!---->Even though this range miscalculation is a violation of potentially security-relevant assumptions, I did not manage to exploit it further.<!----></span><br>While the primitive can be used to construct a node of type `Range(a, 9007199254740991)` with an arbitrary `a` that in reality contains the value `9007199254740992`, recall that one of the conditions it that the node's truncation type is Word32.<span class="line"><!---->While the primitive can be used to construct a node of type `Range(a, 9007199254740991)` with an arbitrary `a` that in reality contains the value `9007199254740992`, recall that one of the conditions it that the node's truncation type is Word32.<!----></span><br>However, all operations (that I could find) that intrinsically truncate to Word32 use typing logic similar to the following from `v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc`:<span class="line"><!---->However, all operations (that I could find) that intrinsically truncate to Word32 use typing logic similar to the following from `v8/src/compiler/operation-typer.cc`:<!----></span><br><br>  Type OperationTyper::NumberToInt32(Type type) {<span class="line"><!---->  Type OperationTyper::NumberToInt32(Type type) {<!----></span><br>    DCHECK(type.Is(Type::Number()));<span class="line"><!---->    DCHECK(type.Is(Type::Number()));<!----></span><br><br>    if (type.Is(Type::Signed32())) return type;<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(Type::Signed32())) return type;<!----></span><br>    if (type.Is(cache_->kZeroish)) return cache_->kSingletonZero;<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(cache_-&gt;kZeroish)) return cache_-&gt;kSingletonZero;<!----></span><br>    if (type.Is(signed32ish_)) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (type.Is(signed32ish_)) {<!----></span><br>      return Type::Intersect(Type::Union(type, cache_->kSingletonZero, zone()),<span class="line"><!---->      return Type::Intersect(Type::Union(type, cache_-&gt;kSingletonZero, zone()),<!----></span><br>                           Type::Signed32(), zone());<span class="line"><!---->                           Type::Signed32(), zone());<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return Type::Signed32();<span class="line"><!---->    return Type::Signed32();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>While those operations could use information from a range with both bounds being 32-bit values, they cannot infer from an input range of the form `Range(a*2^32+b,a*2^32+c)` with `0<=b<c<2^32` and `a>0` that the output will be in `Range(b,c)` - instead they simply set the output to an unconstrained `Signed32` (or `Unsigned32`) type.<span class="line"><!---->While those operations could use information from a range with both bounds being 32-bit values, they cannot infer from an input range of the form `Range(a*2^32+b,a*2^32+c)` with `0&lt;=b&lt;c&lt;2^32` and `a&gt;0` that the output will be in `Range(b,c)` - instead they simply set the output to an unconstrained `Signed32` (or `Unsigned32`) type.<!----></span><br><br>Also, we cannot subtract any fixed value to "shift" the range inside the 32-bit range; recall that one of the conditions for the generation of an (unchecked) Int32 addition is that both inputs are in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type - this clearly can not be the case for our range, which always contains `9007199254740991` (if it isn't empty); thus any following addition or subtraction won't propagate the Word32-truncation to the output of our original addition.<span class="line"><!---->Also, we cannot subtract any fixed value to "shift" the range inside the 32-bit range; recall that one of the conditions for the generation of an (unchecked) Int32 addition is that both inputs are in the `kAdditiveSafeIntegerOrMinusZero` type - this clearly can not be the case for our range, which always contains `9007199254740991` (if it isn't empty); thus any following addition or subtraction won't propagate the Word32-truncation to the output of our original addition.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>The crash has been tested on a debug build of the current master branch of v8 (as of 2020-04-13), as well as in browser version Chromium 89.0.4389.114 on Arch Linux.<span class="line"><!---->The crash has been tested on a debug build of the current master branch of v8 (as of 2020-04-13), as well as in browser version Chromium 89.0.4389.114 on Arch Linux.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>A proof of concept that crashes v8 is attached as `bug.js` (run as `d8 bug.js --allow-natives-syntax`), a version that crashes the chromium tab is attached as `bug.html`.<span class="line"><!---->A proof of concept that crashes v8 is attached as `bug.js` (run as `d8 bug.js --allow-natives-syntax`), a version that crashes the chromium tab is attached as `bug.html`.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Reporter credit: Manfred Paul<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Manfred Paul<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I agree with the analysis that it seems impossible to exploit this, but I wouldn't bet my life on it. I'm keeping it as a Bug-Security and setting Medium severity ("not harmful on their own but potentially harmful when combined with other bugs"). +adetaylor, please let me know if this classification seems off.<span class="line"><!---->I agree with the analysis that it seems impossible to exploit this, but I wouldn't bet my life on it. I'm keeping it as a Bug-Security and setting Medium severity ("not harmful on their own but potentially harmful when combined with other bugs"). +adetaylor, please let me know if this classification seems off.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }
